headline: The Dow bounces back 300 points as Nvidia and Tesla stock surge
summary: The Dow staged a rebound Thursday morning, following Wednesday’s 1,100-point plunge that marked its longest losing streak since 1974. The upturn came despite investor disappointment over the Federal Reserve’s conservative approach to rate cuts. Other major indices, including the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, also experienced gains after a sell-off on Wednesday afternoon.

headline: Nvidia Rises With Momentum Running Hot, Three Giant Aces In Play Analyst Says; Is Nvidia A Buy Or Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia rose 2% early Thursday after the latest challenges to the artificial intelligence chip leader have driven the stock as much as 15% below its all-time high.  Nvidia fell below it for the first time since Sept. 12 on Tuesday last week — ending a nearly three-month-long stint above the benchmark.  If you look back at Nvidia's chart, this week's action is a breakout failure.

headline: Mag 7 gains are supported by Fed's rate cuts, but not dependent
summary: As investors digest the Federal Reserve's 2025 rate cut outlook, Catalysts co-host Madison Mills takes a look at the performance of the "Magnificent Seven," a group made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL), in 2024. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Nvidia Stock Rises. The Fed Rate Scare Could Drive It Even Higher.
summary: Nvidia  stock was rising on Thursday as investors shrugged off the Federal Reserve’s gloomy outlook for 2025.  Nvidia emerged relatively unscathed from Wednesday’s Fed scare, sliding 1.1% on a day when all three blue-chip U.S. indexes—the S&P 500,  and  —plummeted by more than double that.  The selloff came after the Fed cut interest rates by a quarter of a point, but Chair Jerome Powell signaled to the market that the central bank may only lower borrowing costs twice in 2025 because inflation is still running above its 2% target.

headline: Should You Forget Intel and Buy 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Right Now?
summary: One familiar example is Blockbuster Video, which could have purchased Netflix for $50 million, but the CEO didn't see any value in the idea.  Netflix is now worth nearly $400 billion, while Blockbuster is history.  Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) is experiencing something similar although not as permanent.

headline: Think It's Too Late to Buy Nvidia? Here's the Biggest Reason There's Still Time.
summary: Shares of Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) are up 170% in 2024 (at the time of this writing).  All told, shares of the artificial intelligence (AI) juggernaut are up more than 900% since its low in late 2022.  There are all kinds of reasons I could give for why Nvidia will continue to beat the market, but for my money, the biggest reason is simple: Demand remains incredibly strong for its chips.

headline: 1 Wall Street Analyst Thinks Broadcom Is Going to $260. Is It a Buy Now?
summary: Shares of Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) are suddenly soaring.  The diversified semiconductor company impressed the market with its fiscal 2024 fourth-quarter earnings report last week, in particular its artificial intelligence (AI) growth.  Broadcom, which may be best known for networking chips, has become the No. 2 chip stock behind Nvidia in the AI race, and the company now seems to be fulfilling that promise.

headline: US asks Nvidia to investigate how its chips ended up in China, The Information reports
summary: The chip giant has asked big distributors such as Super Micro Computer and Dell Technologies to conduct spot checks of their customers in Southeast Asia, the report said.  Nvidia's artificial intelligence chips are embedded in server products made by Super Micro and Dell.  The Information reported that five different people involved in smuggling Nvidia chips said they have managed so far to evade detection during recent inspections by Super Micro.

raw.headline: US asks Nvidia to investigate how its chips ended up in China, The Information reports

Nvidia's artificial intelligence chips are embedded in server products made by Super Micro and Dell.  The Information reported that five different people involved in smuggling Nvidia chips said they have managed so far to evade detection during recent inspections by Super Micro.

headline: Stock futures recover, government shutdown, Micron: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are staging a slow recovery from yesterday's sell-off fueled by the Federal Reserve's latest interest rate cut and forecasts that illustrate the central bank's plans to cut less in 2025. Backing President-elect Donald Trump's sentiments, Elon Musk is a pivotal voice in opposing House Speaker Mike Johnson's (R) proposed funding deal, intensifying worries of a government shutdown over this weekend right before the holidays. Micron Technology (MU) shares fall lower after releasing fiscal second quarter revenue forecasts that fell below Wall Street expectations. Nike (NKE) is set to report earnings after Thursday's market close. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
